scenarios.name: End-to-End Workflow: Create Formula Metric and Set Custom Target
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the complete happy path for a user creating a new metric using the Formula Builder, adding it to 'My Dashboard', and successfully configuring a 'Custom' target with four performance levels.
user_journey: Navigate to the application URL and verify the login page is displayed.
Enter a valid email address and click 'Continue'.
Enter the correct password and click 'Login'.
Select the specified company from the list.
Verify the dashboard page is displayed after successful login.
Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the navigation menu.
Click the 'Add Metric' button to open the creation form.
Enter the 'Metric Name' into the name input field.
Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface appears with search and operator elements.
Search for and select the 'First Metric' to add to the formula.
Click the desired 'Operator' button.
Search for and select the 'Second Metric' to complete the formula.
Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly and click the green checkmark to confirm.
Click the 'Save' button to create the new metric.
Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the KPI selection modal.
Locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
Click the metric in the left panel to move it to the right panel (selected KPIs).
Click the 'Save' button in the modal to add the KPI to the dashboard.
Hover over the newly added metric card on the dashboard to reveal the three-dot menu.
Click the three-dot menu button and then click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown.
On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
Click the 'Custom' radio button to select the custom target type.
Enter the four 'Custom Target Values' into the corresponding Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 input fields.
Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
Verify the page navigates back to the dashboard.
Confirm the metric card on 'My Dashboard' now displays the visual indicators for the configured custom target.
acceptance_criteria: User successfully logs in and selects a company.
A new metric is successfully created using a formula combining two existing metrics.
The newly created metric is successfully added as a KPI to 'My Dashboard'.
The 'Custom' target is successfully configured with four valid, descending values.
The target configuration is saved without errors.
The metric card on the dashboard correctly displays the visual representation of the saved 'Custom' target.

scenarios.name: Metric Management: Successful Creation of a Metric Using the Formula Builder
scenarios.description: This scenario focuses on the successful creation of a new metric using the Formula Builder. It verifies that the user can correctly construct a formula with two existing metrics and an operator, and save the new metric successfully.
user_journey: Log in and navigate to the 'Metrics' page.
Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Enter a unique 'Metric Name'.
Select 'Formula' as the 'Value Source'.
Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface is displayed.
In the 'Search Metric' input field, enter the name of the 'First Metric' and select it from the results.
Verify the first metric appears in the formula display area.
Click on an 'Operator' button (e.g., '+').
Verify the operator appears in the formula display area.
In the 'Search Metric' input field, enter the name of the 'Second Metric' and select it from the results.
Verify the second metric appears in the formula display area.
Verify the complete formula is displayed in the format: (Metric) [Operator] (Metric).
Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Click the 'Save' button on the metric creation form.
Verify a confirmation message indicates the metric has been created successfully.
acceptance_criteria: The Formula Builder interface appears correctly after selecting 'Formula' as the value source.
User can successfully search for and select existing metrics to use in the formula.
The formula display area updates correctly as metrics and operators are selected.
A valid formula can be confirmed and accepted by the system.
The new formula-based metric is saved successfully without any errors.

scenarios.name: Dashboard & KPI Customization: Add a Pre-existing Metric to 'My Dashboard'
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies that a user can successfully find a pre-existing metric and add it as a new KPI to their 'My Dashboard' section.
user_journey: Log in and navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
Verify the 'My KPIs' section is visible.
Locate and click the 'Edit KPI' icon/button.
Wait for the modal with available and selected metrics to open.
In the left panel (available metrics), locate the desired metric.
Verify the metric is not already present in the right panel (selected KPIs).
Click the metric in the left panel.
Verify the metric automatically moves to the right panel.
Locate and click the 'Save' button in the modal.
Verify the modal closes and the dashboard refreshes.
Confirm the newly added metric card is now visible in the 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens successfully, displaying lists of available and selected metrics.
User can successfully locate a pre-existing metric in the available list.
Clicking an available metric moves it to the selected KPIs list.
Saving the configuration closes the modal and updates the dashboard.
The new KPI card for the selected metric appears correctly on 'My Dashboard'.
